text: [Music]
[Music]
hi I'm Marty a cloud support engineer
here at the Adas office in Sydney today
I'm going to show you how to create a
new IM R that's associated to an
instance profile by using the a web
console and the a CI let's get started
after logging into the Adas Management
console navigate to the IM
console in the navigation panel under
rows choose create row select ads
Service choose ec2 as your use case and
then choose next
permission attach the appropriate
permission for example the ads S3 re
only access policy then choose next text
set any tag for the IM RS if needed then
choose next reveal and set the IM row
name and then choose create
row when you try to launch a new E2
instance you will see the IM instance
profile appear in the drop- down
list as you can see the IM console can
PR easy to instance profile
automatically now let's see how to do
the same in a CI where we will have to
make a few IM am CI calls individually I
will use Linux in my example now I'm in
the CI let's prepare a trust policy Json
document and name it test R trust
policy. Json the content of the document
will look like this to allow ec2 to use
the IM row you must include e2. Amazon
aws.com in the service principle of its
chust
policy now let's call the IM create R CI
to create a new IM row let's name this
new R test
R next we will call I am create instance
profile CI to create a new instance
profile I will name it web
server this is the IM instance profile
name that appears up in the imro drop
down list when launching a new ec2
instance then let's call I am at R to
instance profile C to attach the new I
am R to the instance profile web
server finally you can verify the new
instance profile by I am list instance
profile for row CI and then examine the
instance profile and the IM row names in
the
outputs now you can use the new instance
profile web server to launch E2 instance
taking a look at this example trust
policy keep in mind that if you are
trying to use an existing imro 4c2 you
need to keep its existing trust policy
and add the ec2 service principle into
its existing trust policy for more
information please check out the link on
your
screen thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Music]
